"In Pennsylvania bridges are treated as part of the highway, which is carried and supported by them.... [T]he county owns the bridge, and maintains it for the comfort and convenience of the traveling public."
A bridge is necessarily integral to the highway crossing it, and, thus, it is part of the highway.
A bridge is necessarily integral to the highway crossing it, and, thus, it is part of the highway.
"The rule at common law that a bridge is a part of the highway traversing it was long ago declared to be the law of this State."
